title: appveyor windows error: test_clone.test_invalid_args
body:
```
======================================================================
870ERROR: datalad.core.distributed.tests.test_clone.test_invalid_args
871----------------------------------------------------------------------
...
881  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\core\distributed\tests\test_clone.py", line 109, in test_invalid_args
882    res = clone('Zoidberg', path='ssh://mars:Zoidberg', on_failure='ignore')
...
892    yield from clone_dataset(
893  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\core\distributed\clone.py", line 505, in clone_dataset
894    srcs = _map_urls(cfg or destds.config, srcs)
895  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\distribution\dataset.py", line 344, in config
896    repo = self.repo
897  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\distribution\dataset.py", line 290, in repo
898    self._repo = repo_from_path(self._path)
899  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\core\local\repo.py", line 56, in repo_from_path
900    if not cls.is_valid_repo(path, **ckw):
901  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\support\annexrepo.py", line 670, in is_valid_repo
902    return initialized_annex or GitRepo(path, create=False, init=False).is_with_annex()
903  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\dataset\repo.py", line 146, in __call__
904    id_, new_args, new_kwargs = cls._flyweight_id_from_args(*args, **kwargs)
905  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\dataset\repo.py", line 234, in _flyweight_id_from_args
906    path_postproc = cls._flyweight_postproc_path(localpath)
907  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\site-packages\datalad\dataset\repo.py", line 193, in _flyweight_postproc_path
908    resolved = str(ut.Path(path).resolve().absolute())
909  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\pathlib.py", line 1215, in resolve
910    s = self._flavour.resolve(self, strict=strict)
911  File "C:\Python39-x64\lib\pathlib.py", line 215, in resolve
912    s = self._ext_to_normal(_getfinalpathname(s))
913OSError: [WinError 123] The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect: 'C:\\projects\\datalad\\__testhome__\\ssh:\\mars:Zoidberg'
914
```

it is unclear why this would start failing now. I also cannot replicate this on a local win box.

Clone got a dedicated check for this condition in https://github.com/datalad/datalad/commit/d276c6df388d6b7cc3a45985e020f7f79cbbcca0

(it could be argued that this should rather be an exception)

However, the `OSError` which is being tested for seems to be *not* raised in this test, it *is* raised later on in code that should not have been reached. No idea how to approach this.
